nav.div: Huntington County Community School Corporation » Parents » Coronavirus/COVID-19

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
p.span: HCCSC will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year through May 28, 2020 due to the COVID-19 virus and the executive order by Governor Eric Holcomb. The Indiana State Department of Health will continue to monitor the situation and work in connection with the Indiana Department of Education. We continue to monitor announcements from agencies to keep our students, staff and families safe.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
p.span: HCCSC will continue learning following the schedule below:

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
p.span: HCCSC will continue to observe the cancellation of all extra-curricular, co-curricular, field trips, competitions, and other events until further notice.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
p.span: We will have our sites open for Grab and Go Meals on
April 23rd. This schedule is subject to the access and availability of food supplies. Locations can be found on our web site.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
p.span: We are in the process of preparing information to send to you regarding end of the school year items such as final exams, locker clean out, collection of devices, graduation, Summer School, Migrant Summer School, Kinder Kamp, etc. Please watch for more information to arrive on these items in our FAQ.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
p.span: We continue to take these measures in an abundance of caution to reduce or limit exposure to the virus in our community. We encourage students to stay home during this time and continue to follow the healthy hygiene practices that have been laid out to help stop the spread of COVID-19.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

a.title: FAQ COVID-19
a.span: A Frequently Asked Question document can be found here

p.span: Additional information and updates will be communicated on our website (

span.style: font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif; color: blue;

p.span: ), through SchoolMessenger, and on social media platforms.

p.span: Due to the executive order by Governor Eric Holcomb today, HCCSC will be closed until May 1, 2020 due to the COVID-19 virus. The Indiana State Department of Health will continue to monitor the situation and work in connection with the Indiana Department of Education. We continue to monitor announcements from agencies to keep our students, staff and families safe.

p.span: HCCSC will continue to observe the cancellation of all extra-curricular, co-curricular, field trips, competitions, and other events until further notice.

p.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; color: black;

p.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; color: black;

p.span: We will continue to keep sites open for Grab and Go Meals until April 2 and re-open April 14th through April 30th. All sites are open every Tuesday and Thursday from 10am – 2pm. HNHS will also have evening pick up from 5-7pm. Pick up locations are Andrews Elementary, Roanoke Elementary, Salamonie Elementary, Riverview Middle School and Huntington North High School. This schedule is subject to the access and availability of food supplies.

p.style: color: rgb(33, 33, 33); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; color: black;

p.span: Please be aware that these measures are being taken in an abundance of caution to reduce or limit exposure to the virus in our community. We encourage students to stay home during this time and continue to follow the healthy hygiene practices that have been laid out to help stop the spread of illness.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: 0.25pt; font-family: Verdana, sans-serif, serif, EmojiFont; color: black;

p.span: HCCSC will be closed from March 16 through April 10, 2020 due to the COVID-19 virus. We will be
re-evaluating the situation during Spring Break regarding the return of students on Monday, April
13, 2020. At this time, we feel that closing school is in the best interest of our students, staff

p.style: margin: 0px; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-family: Helvetica;
margin: 0px; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-family: Helvetica;
p.span: Effective Thursday, March 12, 2020, HCCSC cancelled all extra-curricular, co-curricular, field trips,
competitions, and other events until further notice.

p.style: margin: 0px; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-family: Helvetica;
margin: 0px; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-family: Helvetica;
margin: 0px; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-family: Helvetica;

p.span: Huntington County Community School Corporation continues to closely follow new information being released regarding Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and meet daily with the Huntington County Department of Health (HCDH).
The HCDH shares the guidance given by the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) including preventative action steps that we can take to make sure our students, staff, and parents are safe.

This is a very fluid situation and information is constantly changing. The decisions regarding exposure and responses will be made in collaboration with the following agencies: ISDH, HCDH, and EMA. As of right now, Indiana has had 10 confirmed cases and none in Huntington County
p.strong: . It is important to know that decisions on closing a school and for how long are done with the guidance of our county health department, which is communicating with ISDH.
p.span: There is much to be considered as we continue to make the safety of our students our top priority.

HCCSC is actively monitoring supplies, such as cleaning supplies and other personal protective equipment, to appropriately manage resources. Teachers are incorporating handwashing lessons into their classrooms this week.
In addition to our regular updates, in the interim, you may find the following links helpful. These credible resources below can provide up-to-date COVID-19 information:

li.span: See attachments from the Huntington County Department of Health, the Indiana Department of Health, and a Flu vs. COVID-19 guidance.

p.span: HCCSC will continue to work with our state and local officials as we learn new information to stay aligned in our efforts. We will continue to communicate any changes that occur in our plan on a daily/weekly basis.

input.name: ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$ctl16$hfCanUseMultiSelect

div.style: float: right; position: absolute; display: none

div.p: Huntington County Community School Corporation provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment.
